full_text:
Sometimes you have an interesting question: What do 1st round rookie QB's EPA / play look like throughout their first season. 

And then you create a pretty graph that offers almost no conclusion. üòû

#nflverse https://t.co/cOuAtpTOOk

Lamar was slinging the ball downfield against the Lions in a way he never has before. With an average time to throw of 3.9 seconds and an average intended air yards of 19.3, per NextGenStats, Lamar's Week 3 performance stands apart from the rest of his career so far #nflverse https://t.co/sqVSsWR6Yv

As of week 3, though, the model is in love with @BuffaloBills and @RamsNFL, giving each of them a +13% chance of winning the SB, in line with @FiveThirtyEight ELO model #nflverse https://t.co/3pvpaMvRgy

The model faired well in Week 3, calling more games correctly than the market in @LeeSharpeNFL prediction game, though the uncertainty made it less confident, resulting in fewer points :( - though that should change this week with more confidence in team strength #nflverse https://t.co/yg3xtu40ht
Speaking of team strength - the model is starting to create more separation from the haves and the have-nots #nflverse https://t.co/3dNb4zHbtT

i finally made a football graph since who knows when but, qb air yards by down!

main takeaway: Justin fields is going to be soooo much more fun than andy dalton

data: #nflverse https://t.co/phgTq4It30

*small sample size alert*
here's how quarterbacks have done so far in 2021 on plays where the chance they pass is greater than 60% (this includes mostly passes but also sacks and runs) #nflverse https://t.co/pWEv1aV7B1 https://t.co/z5bGJmQxle
Pace and efficiency charts updated with week 2 stats #nflverse https://t.co/G7cfCWAius
Pace and efficiency chart updated with data through Week 3 #nflverse @nfl_data_py https://t.co/mYtrd4t8NW

Starting field position for each team's offensive drives in week 3 üëá

Drives starting inside opponent's 25:
Bills - 3
Rest of NFL - 4

Complementary football.

#nflverse https://t.co/GLbTgJguwM

updated version of David Anderson's game manager vs. gunslinger performance from opensourcefootball.  I wanted to update it for this season after watching Jimmy G for two weeks. seems about right #nflverse https://t.co/v6LUZEsa0b

our take on consensus mkt narratives for every NFL team following week 2 üëÄ

we can see how shifting mkt perceptions have shaped week 3 spreads, using last week's 'lookahead lines' and spring preseason lines as proxies. ++ESPN FPI changes as 'dumb money' sentiment üò¨

#nflverse https://t.co/9RvkEmjh2y

NFL QB DICK Size: The Gunslinger Index. 

Does your QB Demonstrate Innate Confidence and Killer-instinct? https://t.co/gra7Vg8TJH

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/96Hn5EB5AC

@RealSkipBayless said the @dallascowboys are 25-0 when they run more than pass. So I decided to beat the dead horse that is RUN != WIN. https://t.co/hsoZiRlNi2

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/lQ2lXFwLhs

Sometimes you have an interesting question: What do 1st round rookie QB's EPA / play look like throughout their first season. 

And then you create a pretty graph that offers almost no conclusion. üòû

#nflverse https://t.co/cOuAtpTOOk

Why there's basically no need to worry for #Jets fans: Justin Herbert was almost worse all-around against Bill Belichick as a rookie than Wilson was this week. Herbert still ended up winning the rookie of the year. #nflverse https://t.co/5Fy3smetkY
The only thing sadder than talking about your fantasy team is building an analytics site for your fantasy league #kfl #nflverse #ffverse

The magic number in the KFL is 85 points. Score 85 points or more and you have a higher than 50% probability of winning the week. Data based on 2018-2020 seasons. More coming on the KFL analytics blog launching soon. #KFL #ffverse #nflverse https://t.co/nh3aI7x76M
@KFL_analytics #kfl #nflverse #ffverse I did Pythagorean wins for my league to see if I really was always catching everyone on their best week ever

Team Efficiency charts, Week 2

the üëèBroncosüëè are üëèa üëètopüëè 2 üëèoffense üëè

#tableau #nflverse https://t.co/axvtYjJuRd

Week 2 is on the books and the model has made some adjustments - still a lot of variance in the estimates of team strength, but I expect next week's games will provide a ton of clarity #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HR3AuR https://t.co/XKyexOongG

And here are the week 3 projections - the model made some great calls in week 2, but overall missed the mark.  The historical data suggests more predictive accuracy is coming, but we'll see how it plays out using @FiveThirtyEight and @LeeSharpeNFL prediction games! #nflverse https://t.co/Rud1PeQKsp

As of week 3, though, the model is in love with @BuffaloBills and @RamsNFL, giving each of them a +13% chance of winning the SB, in line with @FiveThirtyEight ELO model #nflverse https://t.co/3pvpaMvRgy

The problem with air yards is that a deep target that had no business being caught will inflate a player's total artificially and make the number useless

Here's a version that adjusts for completion probability to counteract this. Not perfect but maybe better

#nflverse https://t.co/as5h1uW4Un

QB Adjusted EPA per Play through week 2. The idea is that quarterbacks will regress towards their career averages, so compared to the first two weeks expect more from:
-Tannehill
-Ryan
-Burrow 

And expect less from:
-Mahomes
-Garappolo
-Stafford
-Bridgewater
#nflverse https://t.co/H1fHYCr7nR

Expected fantasy points distributions for WRs/TEs using targets from Weeks 1 & 2.

Rest assured: AJ Brown SZN is coming

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/Ka6n5mAj3t

Trevor Lawrence had the sixth worst Week 1 & 2 nflfastR CPOE since 2006. He's joined in the bottom 20 by a rookie Matt Stafford, two other first overall picks (JaMarcus & Carson Palmer), XFL legend Josh Freeman, and Blaine Gabbert (3x)

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/6lPAXmLtwH

Which metrics are most correlated with future in-season QB efficiency, and at what point in the season can we trust them?

Notes:
‚Ä¢ EPA/dropback plateaus at W4
‚Ä¢ PFF grade has a higher plateau in W6
‚Ä¢ EPA+CPOE Index overtakes EPA alone in W7

Data: #nflverse / PFF https://t.co/78einZGQUP

This shows offensive EPA per play minus defensive EPA per play for both the home and away teams and plots them as game pairs. Combinations of good offenses with suspect defenses will end up in the upper right.

Data: @nflfastR #nflverse https://t.co/WTGHsjT0fH

QB Accuracy and Average Depth of Target #nflverse 

Davis Mills has 9 fewer air yards than Andy Dalton on 31 fewer attempts üò¨ https://t.co/8YtzQ4OuDv

For this season, the sample is small, but mac jones had a great start. Patriots have run a conservative playbook with aDot below 6 yds. Nobody qb rookie has it since '13 with at least 50 att. Hope for Lawrence and Wilson that they will come back over the average for epa
#nflverse https://t.co/r7BFFnwaQp

@benbbaldwin's code in movement. 

Isn't so readable, but it's funny.
Saints goes for the coast to coast

#nflverse #nfldaznitaly https://t.co/Hcuy22BWr0

A bit spoken about KC's run defense through 2 weeks, despite them facing CLE and BAL. Tried replicating a similar (and cool) plot by @benbbaldwin using {ggforce} to show team success against the run b/w '20 and '21. Small sample, but a noticeable drop-off for KC. #nflverse https://t.co/OXWwF4mVZL

Lamar was slinging the ball downfield against the Lions in a way he never has before. With an average time to throw of 3.9 seconds and an average intended air yards of 19.3, per NextGenStats, Lamar's Week 3 performance stands apart from the rest of his career so far #nflverse https://t.co/sqVSsWR6Yv

Was asked about an example of how I'm using my new fivestars #rstats pkg, so here's a quick and dirty "air yards buy low model" and the code used to generate it (cc #nflverse etc) https://t.co/HoQPxeJ6Vn https://t.co/VDzUsrbIJz

Live in five: more #nflverse work!

https://t.co/byE0SlXj3e

The model faired well in Week 3, calling more games correctly than the market in @LeeSharpeNFL prediction game, though the uncertainty made it less confident, resulting in fewer points :( - though that should change this week with more confidence in team strength #nflverse https://t.co/yg3xtu40ht
Speaking of team strength - the model is starting to create more separation from the haves and the have-nots #nflverse https://t.co/3dNb4zHbtT

The problem with air yards is that a deep target that had no business being caught will inflate a player's total artificially and make the number useless

Here's a version that adjusts for completion probability to counteract this. Not perfect but maybe better
